p: M. pneumoniae DNA was amplified in 12 specimens. Eleven of these were typed according to the M. pneumoniae P1 protein, and all were of type 1. Altogether, 10 M. pneumoniae strains were classified into 5-locus MLVA types (Mpn1, Mpn13-16). When the most discriminatory, but unstable Mpn1 locus was excluded, nine strains were of type 4-5-7-2 and one of type 3-5-7-2. The most common macrolide resistance-associated mutations (in positions 2063G/C and 2064G/C of the 23S rRNA sequence) were not detected in the specimens.
